connectCOMM

public void connectCOMM(int portNumber,
                        boolean withDetect)
                 throws FedmException,
                        FePortDriverException,
                        FeReaderDriverException
Opens a serial port and detects (optional) a reader.

Parameters:
portNumber - the number of the serial port in the range 1..256 (for Linux: 1 is asigned to ttyS0, 2 to ttyS1 and so on)
withDetect - controls the internal detection with findBaudRate and call of ReadReaderInfo
Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException -

Description:
Method opens a serial port and detects (optional, but recommended) a reader and reads information from reader.
The optional detection should only be used if a reader is normally connected and powered on.
After successful opening of the serial port, the reader will be detected with findBaudRate method and if with success the complete reader information is read and can be queried with getReaderInfo.
In case of not detecting a reader the serial port is closed again.
The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
Important Note: After successful opening of the serial port and not detecting of the reader, the detection and the complete read of reader information must be done inside the user application.

connectCOMM

public void connectCOMM(int portNumber,
                        boolean withDetect,
                        int authentType,
                        java.lang.String authentKey)
                 throws FedmException,
                        FePortDriverException,
                        FeReaderDriverException
Opens a serial port and detects (optional) a reader (for secured data transmission).

Parameters:
portNumber - the number of the serial port in the range 1..256 (for Linux: 1 is asigned to ttyS0, 2 to ttyS1 and so on)
withDetect - controls the internal detection with findBaudRate and call of ReadReaderInfo
authentType - authentication type (e.g. AES256)
Authentication Type Value
AES128 0
AES192 1
AES256 (recommended) 2
authentKey - key as a hex formatted string
Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException -

Description:
Method opens a serial port and detects (optional, but recommended) a reader, starts a session for secured data transmission and reads information from reader.
The optional detection should only be used if a reader is normally connected and powered on.
After successful opening of the serial port, the reader will be detected with findBaudRate method and if with success the complete reader information is read and can be queried with getReaderInfo.
In case of not detecting a reader the serial port is closed again.
The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
Important Note: After successful opening of the serial port and not detecting of the reader, the detection and the complete read of reader information must be done inside the user application.

connectBT

public void connectBT(int portNumber,
                      boolean withDetect)
               throws FedmException,
                      FePortDriverException,
                      FeReaderDriverException
Linux: Opens a Bluetooth port and detects (optional) a reader. Windows: Not recommended. Use connectCOMM

Parameters:
portNumber - the number of the Bluetooth port in the range 1..256 (1 is asigned to /dev/rfcomm0, 2 to /dev/rfcomm1 and so on)
withDetect - controls the internal detection with findBaudRate and call of ReadReaderInfo
Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException -

Description:
This method is only for Linux!
Method opens a Bluetooth port and detects (optional, but recommended) a reader and reads information from reader.
The optional detection should only be used if a reader is normally connected and powered on.
After successful opening of the Bluetooth port, the reader will be detected with findBaudRate method and if with success the complete reader information is read and can be queried with getReaderInfo.
In case of not detecting a reader the Bluetooth port is closed again.
The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
Important Note: After successful opening of the Bluetooth port and not detecting of the reader, the detection and the complete read of reader information must be done inside the user application.

connectTCP

public void connectTCP(java.lang.String host,
                       int portNumber)
                throws FedmException,
                       FePortDriverException,
                       FeReaderDriverException
Create a Connection via TCP/IP to a server.

Parameters:
host - the address of the server (e.g. "192.168.1.1")
portNumber - the ip port
Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException -

Description:
Method creates a TCP/IP network connection and reads information from the reader.
The port number should be used in ranges of 1024 and 65535.
The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
After successful established connection, the reader information is read and is queried with getReaderInfo getReaderInfo.

AES192 1

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException -

Description:
Method creates a TCP/IP network connection, starts a session for secured data transmission and reads information from the reader.
The port number should be used in ranges of 1024 and 65535.
The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.

connectUSB

public void connectUSB(long deviceID)
                throws FedmException,
                       FePortDriverException,
                       FeReaderDriverException
Opens a USB port for a USB reader

Parameters:
deviceID -
Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException -

Description:
Method creates a connection with an USB reader and reads information from the reader.
If deviceID is 0 then the first scanned USB reader will be used. In this case, only one USB reader should be connected.
If multiple USB readers are connected and must be handled at the same time, then the helper class FeUsb has methods implemented to scan the USB and to query the deviceIDs.
The connect method can be used once for every reader object. If the port must be changed, the opened port must first be closed with the method disConnect.
After successful established connection, the reader information is read and is queried with getReaderInfo getReaderInfo.

disConnect

public int disConnect()
               throws FedmException,
                      FePortDriverException,
                      FeReaderDriverException
This method disconnect the device and frees the allocated memory.

Returns:
0 if successful or (only for TCP/IP conections) >0 the last TCP state

Description:
Method disconnects a port which was previously opened with one of the three connect methods.
For TCP/IP connections: if any problem while closing the socket occurs, the last socket state is returned.
The following socket states are defined:
socket state Value
Closed 1
Listen 2
SYN Sent 3
SYN Received 4
Established 5
FIN Wait 1 6
FIN Wait 2 7
Close Wait 8
Closing 9
Last ACK 10
Time Wait 11

Throws:
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

readerAuthentication

public int readerAuthentication(int authentType,
                                java.lang.String authentKey)
                         throws FePortDriverException,
                                FeReaderDriverException,
                                FedmException
Execute of Authentication process

Parameters:
authentType - authentication type (e.g. AES256)
Authentication Type Value
AES128 0
AES192 1
AES256 (recommended) 2
authentKey - key as a hex formatted string
Returns:
status - an integer with the status byte (>=0) or error code (<0)

Description:
Starts a session with secured data transmission.
The first secured session must be started with connectTCP. After every authentication error, the restart of a session can be executed with this method.
This method can be used with TCP/IP communication.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.

FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

sendProtocol

public int sendProtocol(byte cmdByte)
                 throws FePortDriverException,
                        FeReaderDriverException,
                        FedmException
The central communication method.

Parameters:
cmdByte - control byte
Returns:
status an integer with the status byte (>=0) or error code (<0)

Description:
Protocol traffic is executed with the method sendProtocol. This gets only the control byte of the desired protocol. All the data necessary for the protocol transfer are taken from the data containers resp. tables. You must therefore ensure that all the protocol data have first been updated.
This communication method can be used with all port drivers.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.

Throws:
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

sendProtocol

public java.lang.String sendProtocol(byte cmdByte,
                                     java.lang.String requestData)
                              throws FePortDriverException,
                                     FeReaderDriverException,
                                     FedmException
An alternative communication method.

Parameters:
cmdByte - control byte
requestData - request data string
Returns:
the response data

Description:
This alternative communication method is for special cases, if the request data must be built without the internal data containers.
This communication method can be used with all port drivers.
If an error occurs, the error code can be queried with the getErrorCode method of the exception class.
If the reader signals a status, the response data string can be null. In this case, the status byte should be queried with getLastStatus.

Throws:
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

sendTransparent

public java.lang.String sendTransparent(java.lang.String requestProtocol,
                                        boolean calcCrc)
                                 throws FePortDriverException,
                                        FeReaderDriverException,
                                        FedmException
An alternative communication method.

Parameters:
requestProtocol - request protocol string with frame
calcCrc - set true, to calculate and add CRC to protocol frame
Returns:
the response protocol

Description:
This alternative communication method is for special cases, if the build of a protocol (inclusive the protocol frame) must be done under control of an application.
This communication method can be used with all port drivers.
If an error occurs, the error code can be queried with the getErrorCode method of the exception class.

Throws:
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

sendSAMCommand

public byte[] sendSAMCommand(int slot,
                             byte[] requestData,
                             int timeout)
                      throws java.lang.Exception,
                             FePortDriverException,
                             FeReaderDriverException,
                             FedmException
Synchronous communication method for SAM (Secure Application Module) command for OBID® classic-pro reader family.

Parameters:
slot - SAM slot number
requestData - buffer with date to be sent to SAM
timeout - timeout in steps of 100 milliseconds
Returns:
response data or null in error case

Description:
Protocol traffic is executed with this method. The communication is executed synchronously and waits until the response is returned by the reader.
This communication method can be used with serial and USB port drivers.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

sendSAMCommand

public int sendSAMCommand(FedmTaskListener listener,
                          int slot,
                          byte[] requestData,
                          int timeout)
                   throws java.lang.Exception,
                          FePortDriverException,
                          FeReaderDriverException,
                          FedmException
Asynchronous communication method for SAM (Secure Application Module) command for OBID® classic-pro reader family.

Parameters:
listener - is an object inherited from FedmTaskListener
slot - SAM slot number
requestData - buffer with date to be sent to SAM
timeout - timeout in steps of 100 milliseconds
Returns:
an integer with OK (=0) or error code (<0) or status byte from response (>0)

Description:
Protocol traffic is executed with this method. As the communication is executed asynchronously, this method returns immediately after sending the command to the reader.
The end of communication is signaled by invoking onNewSAMResponse of the listener object.
This communication method can be used with serial and USB port drivers.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.

Throws:
java.lang.Exception
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

sendCommandQueue

public int sendCommandQueue(FedmCprCommandQueue queue)
                     throws FePortDriverException,
                            FeReaderDriverException,
                            FedmException
Asynchronous communication method for command queues for OBID® classic-pro reader family.

Parameters:
queue - command queue object
Returns:
an integer with OK (=0) or error code (<0)

Description:
Protocol traffic is executed with this method. All the data necessary for the protocol transfer are taken from the queue container. You must therefore ensure that all the protocol data have first been updated.
As the communication is executed asynchronously, this method returns immediately after sending the command to the reader.
The end of communication is signaled by invoking onNewQueueResponse of the listener object.
This communication method can be used with serial and USB port drivers.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.

Throws:
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

sendTclApdu

public int sendTclApdu(FedmCprApdu apdu)
                throws FePortDriverException,
                       FeReaderDriverException,
                       FedmException
Communication method for synchronous or asynchronous T=CL APDU for OBID® classic-pro reader family.

Parameters:
apdu - object
Returns:
an integer with OK (=0) or error code (<0) or status byte (>0)

Description:
Protocol traffic is executed with this method. All the data necessary for the protocol transfer are taken from the apdu object. You must therefore ensure that all the protocol data have first been updated.
The communication is executed asynchronously when the apdu object is created with a listener. In this case, this method returns immediately after sending the command to the reader.
The end of communication is signaled by invoking onNewApduResponse of the listener object. The communication is executed synchronously when the apdu object is created without a listener. In this case, this method returns after receiving the APDU response.
This communication method can be used with serial and USB port drivers.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.

Throws:
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException
FePortDriverException

tagInventory

public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,FedmIscTagHandler> tagInventory(boolean all,
                                                                          byte mode,
                                                                          byte antennas)
                                                                   throws FedmException,
                                                                          FePortDriverException,
                                                                          FeReaderDriverException
Method to execute an Inventory and generation of Taghandler objects returned in a HashHap.

Description:
An Inventory is executed. The command is controlled by some parameters and collects all Transponders in a HashMap.
The parameters are explained in detail in the Reader's system manual.

Parameters:
all - automatic mode with internal ResetTable and MORE-loop. This parameter should be set normally to true.
mode - manual control of inventory (if bAll=true, MORE-Flag will be ignored). This parameter should be set normally to 0
antennas - flag field with antennas (only for i-scan Readers). This parameter should be set normally to 1.
Returns:
HashMap with collected Transponders

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException -

Example 
 

 
     import de.feig.*;
     import de.feig.TagHandler.*;

     FedmIscReader reader = new FedmIscReader();
     HashMap mapTH = null;
     FedmIscTagHandler th = null;
     FedmIscTagHandler_Result res = new FedmIscTagHandler_Result();
     int back = 0;
     int tagDriver = 0;
     …
     try
     {
         // Inventory with standard options
         mapTH = reader.tagInventory(true, (byte)0, (byte)1);
         for ( Map.Entry e : mapTH.entrySet() )
         {
             th = e.getValue(); // TagHandler from HashMap
             // select Transponder:
             // necessary for ISO 14443 (optional: set tagDriver (s. System Manual of Reader))
             // optional for ISO 15693
             // not for EPC Class 1 Gen 2
             th = reader.tagSelect(th, tagDriver);

             if(th instanceof FedmIscTagHandler_ISO15693)
             {
                 FedmIscTagHandler_ISO15693 thIso = (FedmIscTagHandler_ISO15693)th;
                 // read datablocks and write same data back
                 back = thIso.readMultipleBlocksWithSecStatus(4, 4, res);
                 back = thIso.writeMultipleBlocks(4, 4, 4, res.data);
             }
             else if(th instanceof FedmIscTagHandler_ISO14443_4_MIFARE_DESFire)
             {
                 FedmIscTagHandler_ISO14443_4_MIFARE_DESFire thIso = (FedmIscTagHandler_ISO14443_4_MIFARE_DESFire)th;
                 // read version information
                 // use of the internal Interface IFlexSoftCrypto
                 back = thIso.IFlexSoftCrypto.getVersion((byte)0, res);
             }
             else if(th instanceof FedmIscTagHandler_EPC_Class1_Gen2)
             {
                 FedmIscTagHandler_EPC_Class1_Gen2 thGen2 = (FedmIscTagHandler_EPC_Class1_Gen2)th;
                 // write new EPC to Transponder (without Password)
                 thGen2.writeEPC("0102030405060708090A0B0C", "");
             }
         }
     }
     catch(java.lang.Exception e)
     {
         …
     }

tagSelect

public FedmIscTagHandler tagSelect(FedmIscTagHandler tagHandler,
                                   int tagDriver)
                            throws FedmException,
                                   FePortDriverException,
                                   FeReaderDriverException
Method to execute a Select command.

Description:
A [0xB0][0x25] Select command is executed. The command is controlled by an optional tagDriver.
The parameter tagDriver is explained in detail in the Reader's system manual.

Parameters:
tagHandler - A TagHandler object from the TagHandler-List, created by tagInventory.
tagDriver - Optional transponder driver to be used for the Select comnand
Returns:
TagHandler object in selected state (can be based on a new TagHandler class) or null in error cases (e.g. loss of transponder)

Throws:
FedmException
FePortDriverException
FeReaderDriverException

buildSendProtocol

public byte[] buildSendProtocol(FeIscProtocol prt)
Method to built a reader-protocol. This method returns a byte-array, that contains the length of the protocol as the first byte, the command byte as the second followed by the data-array and the CRC-Checksum.

Parameters:
prt - Protocol Object
Returns:
a byte array with the protocol

Description:

splitRecProtocol

public int splitRecProtocol(FeIscProtocol prt)
Splits the protocol into the components. The components are the length, the command byte, data and the CRC. The protocol length and the CRC will be tested and raise an exception if an error occurs.

Parameters:
prt - Protocol Object
Returns:
OK (=0) or status byte (>0) or error code (<0)
Throws:
FeReaderDriverProtocolFrameException -

Description:

serialize

public int serialize(boolean read,
                     java.lang.String fileName)
              throws FedmException
Method for serialization of the reader configuration into or from an XML file.

Parameters:
read - control parameter to read (true) from an XML file or (false) write into an XML file.
fileName - complete file name with directory
Throws:
FedmException -

Description:
This method enables to load (if read = true) a reader configuration from an XML file into the data containers EEPROM and RAM, or writes (if read = false) the content of the data containers into an XML file.
The configuration in the reader keeps unchanged.

getByteArrayData

public byte[] getByteArrayData(int address,
                               int length,
                               int memID)
Gets a byte array from a data container.

Parameters:
address - is the index of the first byte in the data container
length - is the number of byte to be read
memID - is the constant with the memory identifier (see interface FedmIscReaderConst)
Returns:
byte array

Description:
Method for reading a byte array parameter by use of the address from a data container.
This method is usefull to get parameters with a length of more than 16 byte from a data
container, which cannot be read by use of an access constant.
The address (index of first byte) can be calculated with the method FeMethods.getAdrOfID.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set and the method returns null.
This method can throw a FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

setData

public int setData(java.lang.String id,
                   boolean data)
Sets a boolean data into a data container.

Parameters:
id - is the access constant (see interface FedmIscReaderID)
data - contains the value to be set in the data container
Returns:
Fedm.OK or Fedm.MODIFIED, if successful, otherwise an error code

Description:
Overload method for writing a boolean parameter value into a data container.
The memory location of the boolean data is specified by the id parameter.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.
Fedm.MODIFIED is returned, if the data value in the data container is modified.
If the data value is unchanged, Fedm.OK is returned.
This method can throw a FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.

getTableSize

public int getTableSize(int tableID)
                 throws FedmException
Gets the size of a table.

Parameters:
tableID - table constant (see interface FedmIscReaderConst)
Returns:
size of a table or error code (<0)

Description:
Method returns the size of the table, identified by tableID.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.
This method can throw a FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
The method can be used with the tables:

FedmBrmTableItem (BRM_TABLE)

FedmIsoTableItem (ISO_TABLE)

X

X

Throws:
FedmException

setTableSize

public void setTableSize(int tableID,
                         int size)
                  throws FedmException
Sets the size of a table.

Parameters:
tableID - table constant (see interface FedmIscReaderConst)
size - is the new size of the table

Description:
Method sets the size of the table, identified by tableID.
The size of the internal tables ISO_TABLE and BRM_TABLE are zero. Thus, the size of a table must be set before the first communication is started or the first access to the table. The size should be set to the maximal number of transponders simulaniously in the reader field.
After an invoke of deleteTable, the table length is set to 0, but the table size is unchanged.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.
This method can throw a FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
The method can be used with the tables:

FedmBrmTableItem (BRM_TABLE)

FedmIsoTableItem (ISO_TABLE)

X

X

Throws:
FedmException

setTableSize

public void setTableSize(int tableID,
                         int size,
                         int rxDB_BlockCount,
                         int rxDB_BlockSize,
                         int txDB_BlockCount,
                         int txDB_BlockSize)
                  throws FedmException
Sets the size of a table and set the internal buffer for the transponder data to customized values.

Parameters:
tableID - table constant (see interface FedmIscReaderConst)
size - is the new size of the table
rxDB_BlockCount - is the new size of buffer for read date in the table
rxDB_BlockSize - is the new block size of buffer for read date in the table
txDB_BlockCount - is the new size of buffer for write data in the table
txDB_BlockSize - is the new block size of buffer for write date in the table

Description:
Method sets the size of the table, identified by tableID.
The size of the internal tables ISO_TABLE and BRM_TABLE are zero. Thus, the size of a table must be set before the first communication is started or the first access to the table. The size should be set to the maximal number of transponders simulaniously in the reader field. Additionally, the internal buffer for the transponder data are set to customized values.
After an invoke of deleteTable, the table length is set to 0, but the table size is unchanged.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.
This method can throw a FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
The method can be used with the tables:

FedmBrmTableItem (BRM_TABLE)

FedmIsoTableItem (ISO_TABLE)

X

X

Throws:
FedmException

getTableLength

public int getTableLength(int tableID)
                   throws FedmException
Gets the number of elements of a table.

Parameters:
tableID - table constant (see interface FedmIscReaderConst)
Returns:
number of elemtents of a table or error code (<0)

Description:
Method returns the number of elements of the table, identified by tableID.
The range of table length is: 0 <= table length <= table size.
After an invoke of deleteTable, the table length is set to 0, but the table size is unchanged.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set.
This method can throw a FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
The method can be used with the tables:

verifyTableDataBlocks

public int verifyTableDataBlocks(int idx,
                                 int tableID,
                                 int blockNr,
                                 int blockCnt)
Method for verify received with sent transponder data block(s) in table.

Parameters:
idx - table index
tableID - table constant (see interface FedmIscReaderConst)
blockNr - first number of data block
blockCnt - number of blocks to be verified
Returns:
Fedm.OK or an error code (<0)

Description:
The internal table ISO_TABLE has separate memories for received and transmit data. This allows the verification of sent with received transponder data. The table attribute blockSize, which contains the number of byte in each data block, is used internally. Thus, the blockSize attribute must be previously set.
If the content of the data blocks are equal, then the method returns Fedm.OK, otherwise Fedm.ERROR_VERIFY.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set and the method returns an error code (<0).
This method can throw a FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
The method can be used with the tables:

FedmBrmTableItem (BRM_TABLE)

FedmIsoTableItem (ISO_TABLE)

X

public int verifyTableDataBytes(int idx,
                                int tableID,
                                int startByte,
                                int byteCnt)
Method for verify received with sent transponder data byte(s) in table.

Parameters:
idx - table index
tableID - table constant (see interface FedmIscReaderConst)
startByte - first byte
byteCnt - number of byte to be verified
Returns:
Fedm.OK or an error code (<0)

Description:
The internal table ISO_TABLE has separate memories for received and transmit data. This allows the verification of sent with received transponder data. This method verifies data byte without the limitation of the blocksize.
If the content of the data byte are equal, then the method returns Fedm.OK, otherwise Fedm.ERROR_VERIFY.
If an error occurs, the lastError attribute is set and the method returns an error code (<0).
This method can throw a FedmException, if an error occurs inside the Java Native Interface.
The method can be used with the tables:

FedmBrmTableItem (BRM_TABLE)

FedmIsoTableItem (ISO_TABLE)

startAsyncTask

public void startAsyncTask(int taskID,
                           FedmTaskListener listener,
                           FedmTaskOption opt)
                    throws java.lang.Exception,
                           FedmException,
                           FeReaderDriverException
This method starts an asynchronous task.

Parameters:
taskID - task identifier
listener - is an object inherited from FedmTaskListener
opt - collects the task options
Throws:
java.lang.Exception
FedmException
FeReaderDriverException -

Description:
An asynchronous task is an internal thread which e.g. sends an inventory command to the reader and waits for the reply for a time up to the timeout. Signaling of the reply data or the cancel condition to the application is done by invoking a listener method.
The reader mode must be set to:

reader mode

task identifier

remarks

Host Mode

ID_FIRST_NEW_TAG
ID_EVERY_NEW_TAG

A task can only started if the following option is integrated in the Reader's firmware: the Reader protocol [0xB0][0x01] Inventory must support an optional NOTIFY flag in its Mode byte.
After receiving the Reader protocol within the specified time, the task invokes the listener method onNewTag and automatically closes itself. If the time is exceeded, the listener method is invoked and the status 0x01 (No transponder in read field) is sent and the task ended.
In case of an error the task always ended immediately and the listener method transmits the error code.
Serial, USB and TCP/IP interfaces are supported, whereby the ports must be open before starting the task. Autonomous opening of the connection via TCP/IP by the Reader or a suitable converter for sending the data is not possible.
Repeating inventory (taskID=ID_EVERY_NEW_TAG) defines a cyclical task which can only be cancelled by cancelAsyncTask. A cycle corresponds to a one-time inventory and ends on a wait loop until the next cycle has been triggered by the application using triggerAsyncTask. Application-side triggering ensures that an application has time for receiving and processing the inventory data.

Notification Mode

ID_NOTIFICATION

A task should only be started if notification mode is integrated and activated in the Reader's firmware.
Only TCP/IP communication is supported.
Possible connection options are (see system manual for the Reader):
-Temporary opening of the connection by the Reader for the duration of data transmission
-Continuous opening of the connection by the Reader (in development)
-Continuous opening of the connection by the host (in development)
The task defines an endless task which can only be cancelled using cancelAsyncTask or in case of error during the initialization phase is ended immediately after invoking the listener method onNewNotification. The task waits for reception of the Buffered-Read-Mode data and then invokes the listener method onNewNotification. After the listener method returns, data can immediately be received again by the Reader.
In case of transmission errors the listener method is invoked with the error code and the receiving procedure then resumed.
If the Keep-Alive option is activated (by default), then the listener socket is closed automatically after a break of the network cable or after loss of power and is recovered again. This ensures the reliability of the network connection.
The timing for closing the socket by Keep-Alive is calculated by the formula:
IdleTime + RepeatCount * IntervalTime
where the default settings are:
- IdleTime is 500ms
- RepeatCount is 5 (Linux, Window XP) or 10 (Windows Vista or Windows 7)
- IntervalTime is 500ms
Note: Depending on the Reader setting large quantities of data may be sent by the Reader in very short time intervals. Without use of a handshake procedure (see system manual for the Reader) data may be lost if the host is not appropriate for the quantity of notifications.

cancelAsyncTask

public int cancelAsyncTask()
Cancels an inventory or notification task.

Returns:
Fedm.OK or an error code (< 0).

You should not normally use one-time inventory (started with TaskID = ID_FIRST_NEW_TAG) to quit this function. You should end repeating inventory (started with TaskID = ID_EVERY_NEW_TAG) using this function if the listener method was ended and the internal thread is waiting for the next trigger. This ensures that the task in the reader is ended and it can again process reader tasks.
Notification tasks must always be canceled with this function.
The cancellation of the task is locked if the task execution is just inside the delegate. This prevents deadlocks. In this case this method returns directly with the return value FEISC_ERR_TASK_BUSY (-4084) and the application must invoke cancelAsyncTask in a loop continuously, until the return value is 0.

triggerAsyncTask

public void triggerAsyncTask()
This function is used to trigger the next inventory cycle in the asynchronous task.

The asynchronous task must have been previously started with the TaskID = ID_EVERY_NEW_TAG. This method is always invoked after the delegate has been exited. Without this invoke a task with repeating function hangs up in a wait loop.

addEventListener

public void addEventListener(FeIscListener l,
                             int event)
                      throws FedmException
Installs an event handling method.

Parameters:
event - constant with event id
l - is an object inherited of FeIscListener
Throws:
FedmException -
Description:
This method is used to install an event handler method for protocol notifications.
With the methods of FeIscListener, it is easy to realize a protocol window, to get the scanned data of a reader, working in scan mode, or to transfer the raw send or receive protocols to the application.
The following event IDs, which are listed in the interface FeIscListener, are possible:

Event ID

Note

TRANSCEIVE_STRING_EVENT

String with date and time and send or receive protocol

SEND_STRING_EVENT

String with date and time and send protocol

RECEIVE_STRING_EVENT

String with date and time and receive protocol

SCANNER_PRT_EVENT

Byte array with receive data

SEND_PRT_EVENT

Byte array with send protocol

RECEIVE_PRT_EVENT

Byte array with receive protocol

Description:
This method is used to remove an event handler method for protocol notifications.
